bibl.title: Mac Fock v. State of Washington. Order to Show Cause
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of MAC FOCK for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

The above named petitioner, having made application to this Court for a writ of Habeas corpus, addressed to the Honorable Ellis DeBruler, Commissioner of Immigration, in charge of the immigration service at Seattle, in said District, in whose custody the petition shows the petitioner is confined and restrained from his liberty, pursuant to certain proceedings looking to his deportation under the various acts of Congress providing for the exclusion of Chinese persons; and the Court being fully advised, now on motion of L. Frank Brown, Counsel for the petitioner.

IT IS ORDERED that the Honorable Ellis DeBruler, Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, in said district, and the inspector or other person in charge of the person of Mac Fock, the petitioner, show cause before this Court at the court room in the Federal Building in the City of Seattle, in said district, on 16th, June, A.D. 1913, at 2 o'clock in the after noon, why said application should not be granted, and in the meantime, you, the Honorable Ellis DeBruler, Commissioner as aforesaid, as well as the inspectors or other persons in charge of the person of Mac Fock, refrain and desist from deporting or removing said petitioner from said district, or carrying into effect any warrant or order for his deportation which may be held by you or either of you. This order not to be in effect until petitioner departs with the burden of the Court $100.00 to issue the payment of the expense of detention pending determination.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED, that a certified copy of this order shall be served upon the said Ellis DeBruler and the inspector of either of them, or any person in charge fo the said Mac Fock, on or before the 16th day of June, A.D. 1913. Done this 9th day of June, A.D. 1913.
Service of the above order to show cause acknowledged this day of June, A.D. 1913, by receipt of certified copy thereof.
Service of the above Order to Show Cause acknowledged in behalf of Ellis DeBruler, Commissioner of Immigration, and his inspectors, in charge of the body of said Mac Fock, this day of , A.D. 1913.
